endpoints.desc:
Get a copy of the current state and the most recent messages in a room.

This endpoint was deprecated in r0 of this specification. There is no
direct replacement; the relevant information is returned by the
|/sync|_ API. See the `migration guide
<https://matrix.org/docs/guides/client-server-migrating-from-v1.html#deprecated-endpoints>`_.

path.desc: **Required.** The room to get the data.
path.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** The ID of this room.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: The user's membership state in this room. One of: ["invite", "join", "leave", "ban"]
res_tables.title: enum

res_tables.desc: The pagination chunk for this room.
res_tables.title: PaginationChunk

res_tables.desc:
If the user is a member of the room this will be the
current state of the room as a list of events. If the
user has left the room this will be the state of the
room when they left it.
res_tables.title: [StateEvent]

res_tables.desc:
Whether this room is visible to the ``/publicRooms`` API
or not." One of: ["private", "public"]
res_tables.title: enum

res_tables.desc: The private data that this user has attached to this room.
res_tables.title: [Event]

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** A token which correlates to the first value in ``chunk``.
Used for pagination.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** A token which correlates to the last value in ``chunk``.
Used for pagination.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** If the user is a member of the room this will be a
list of the most recent messages for this room. If
the user has left the room this will be the
messages that preceeded them leaving. This array
will consist of at most ``limit`` elements.
res_tables.title: [RoomEvent]

res_tables.desc: **Required.** The fields in this object will vary depending on the type of event. When interacting with the REST API, this is the HTTP body.
res_tables.title: object

res_tables.desc: **Required.** The type of event. This SHOULD be namespaced similar to Java package naming conventions e.g. 'com.example.subdomain.event.type'
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** The globally unique event identifier.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** Contains the fully-qualified ID of the user who sent this event.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** Timestamp in milliseconds on originating homeserver when this event was sent.
res_tables.title: integer

res_tables.desc: Contains optional extra information about the event.
res_tables.title: UnsignedData

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** The ID of the room associated with this event. Will not be present on events
that arrive through ``/sync``, despite being required everywhere else.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** The fields in this object will vary depending on the type of event. When interacting with the REST API, this is the HTTP body.
res_tables.title: object

res_tables.desc: **Required.** The type of event. This SHOULD be namespaced similar to Java package naming conventions e.g. 'com.example.subdomain.event.type'
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** The globally unique event identifier.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** Contains the fully-qualified ID of the user who sent this event.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** Timestamp in milliseconds on originating homeserver when this event was sent.
res_tables.title: integer

res_tables.desc: Contains optional extra information about the event.
res_tables.title: UnsignedData

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** The ID of the room associated with this event. Will not be present on events
that arrive through ``/sync``, despite being required everywhere else.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: Optional. The previous ``content`` for this event. If there is no previous content, this key will be missing.
res_tables.title: EventContent

res_tables.desc:
**Required.** A unique key which defines the overwriting semantics for this piece of room state. This value is often a zero-length string. The presence of this key makes this event a State Event.
State keys starting with an ``@`` are reserved for referencing user IDs, such as room members. With the exception of a few events, state events set with a given user's ID as the state key MUST only be set by that user.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: The time in milliseconds that has elapsed since the event was sent. This field is generated by the local homeserver, and may be incorrect if the local time on at least one of the two servers is out of sync, which can cause the age to either be negative or greater than it actually is.
res_tables.title: integer

res_tables.desc: The event that redacted this event, if any.
res_tables.title: Event

res_tables.desc:
The client-supplied transaction ID, for example, provided via
``PUT /_matrix/client/r0/rooms/{roomId}/send/{eventType}/{txnId}``,
if the client being given the event is the same one which sent it.
res_tables.title: string

res_tables.desc: **Required.** The fields in this object will vary depending on the type of event. When interacting with the REST API, this is the HTTP body.
res_tables.title: object

res_tables.desc: **Required.** The type of event. This SHOULD be namespaced similar to Java package naming conventions e.g. 'com.example.subdomain.event.type'
res_tables.title: string

responses.description: The current state of the room
You aren't a member of the room and weren't previously a member of the room.

endpoints.title: Snapshot the current state of a room and its most recent messages.

get.description:
Get a copy of the current state and the most recent messages in a room.

This endpoint was deprecated in r0 of this specification. There is no
direct replacement; the relevant information is returned by the
|/sync|_ API. See the `migration guide
<https://matrix.org/docs/guides/client-server-migrating-from-v1.html#deprecated-endpoints>`_.

parameters.description: The room to get the data.
parameters.name: roomId

200.description: The current state of the room

content.body: This is an example text message

account_data.description: The private data that this user has attached to this room.

allOf.description: The basic set of fields all events must have.

content.description: The fields in this object will vary depending on the type of event. When interacting with the REST API, this is the HTTP body.

type.description: The type of event. This SHOULD be namespaced similar to Java package naming conventions e.g. 'com.example.subdomain.event.type'

allOf.title: Event

membership.description: The user's membership state in this room.

messages.description: The pagination chunk for this room.

chunk.description:
If the user is a member of the room this will be a
list of the most recent messages for this room. If
the user has left the room this will be the
messages that preceeded them leaving. This array
will consist of at most ``limit`` elements.

allOf.description: The basic set of fields all events must have.

content.description: The fields in this object will vary depending on the type of event. When interacting with the REST API, this is the HTTP body.

type.description: The type of event. This SHOULD be namespaced similar to Java package naming conventions e.g. 'com.example.subdomain.event.type'

allOf.title: Event

allOf.description: In addition to the Event fields, Room Events have the following additional fields.

origin_server_ts.description: Timestamp in milliseconds on originating homeserver when this event was sent.

sender.description: Contains the fully-qualified ID of the user who sent this event.

unsigned.description: Contains optional extra information about the event.

age.description: The time in milliseconds that has elapsed since the event was sent. This field is generated by the local homeserver, and may be incorrect if the local time on at least one of the two servers is out of sync, which can cause the age to either be negative or greater than it actually is.

redacted_because.description: The event that redacted this event, if any.
redacted_because.title: Event

transaction_id.description:
The client-supplied transaction ID, for example, provided via
``PUT /_matrix/client/r0/rooms/{roomId}/send/{eventType}/{txnId}``,
if the client being given the event is the same one which sent it.

unsigned.title: UnsignedData

allOf.title: SyncRoomEvent

allOf.description: Room Events have the following fields.

room_id.description:
The ID of the room associated with this event. Will not be present on events
that arrive through ``/sync``, despite being required everywhere else.

allOf.title: RoomEvent

end.description:
A token which correlates to the last value in ``chunk``.
Used for pagination.

start.description:
A token which correlates to the first value in ``chunk``.
Used for pagination.

messages.title: PaginationChunk

If the user is a member of the room this will be the
current state of the room as a list of events. If the
user has left the room this will be the state of the
room when they left it.

unsigned.description: Contains optional extra information about the event.

age.description: The time in milliseconds that has elapsed since the event was sent. This field is generated by the local homeserver, and may be incorrect if the local time on at least one of the two servers is out of sync, which can cause the age to either be negative or greater than it actually is.

content.description: The fields in this object will vary depending on the type of event. When interacting with the REST API, this is the HTTP body.

type.description: The type of event. This SHOULD be namespaced similar to Java package naming conventions e.g. 'com.example.subdomain.event.type'

allOf.title: Event

allOf.description: In addition to the Event fields, Room Events have the following additional fields.

origin_server_ts.description: Timestamp in milliseconds on originating homeserver when this event was sent.

sender.description: Contains the fully-qualified ID of the user who sent this event.

unsigned.description: Contains optional extra information about the event.

age.description: The time in milliseconds that has elapsed since the event was sent. This field is generated by the local homeserver, and may be incorrect if the local time on at least one of the two servers is out of sync, which can cause the age to either be negative or greater than it actually is.

transaction_id.description:
The client-supplied transaction ID, for example, provided via

unsigned.title: UnsignedData

allOf.description: In addition to the Room Event fields, State Events have the following additional fields.

prev_content.description: Optional. The previous ``content`` for this event. If there is no previous content, this key will be missing.
prev_content.title: EventContent

state_key.description:
A unique key which defines the overwriting semantics for this piece of room state. This value is often a zero-length string. The presence of this key makes this event a State Event.
State keys starting with an ``@`` are reserved for referencing user IDs, such as room members. With the exception of a few events, state events set with a given user's ID as the state key MUST only be set by that user.

allOf.title: SyncStateEvent

allOf.title: StateEvent

visibility.description:
Whether this room is visible to the ``/publicRooms`` API
or not."

403.description: You aren't a member of the room and weren't previously a member of the room.

accessToken.description: The access_token returned by a call to ``/login`` or ``/register``
accessToken.name: access_token
